column2: Identify a Partnership with a company that has already established themselves. Identify companies to reach out to for donations (Minimum 10). Identify grants to be used for the class. (Minimum 10)
column3: Create a sandbox (Fall 2026) & Tech stack (Fall 2026). A container for testing the product. Define Functional and Not Functional mandatory pieces of the user interface. Componentization of the user interface. Figma mockups, information boarding. Work on the customization side, specifically within the code. (Ex: Grouping Ratio’s, show: True/False) End goal the UI is completely adaptable by the AI.
column4: Create a separate team for Research and Development. Creating documentation within the R&D department. New leadership position, and new team, required for every semester.
column5: Are we meeting the basic requirements of accessibility? Identify what level the product meets. (WCAG 2.0)? 2.1?
column6: (A team designated to 10k/10Q) Reach out to the APMP team for advice and review of the product. The general requirements of the NASDAQ. There are 50 total. Research and understand what is required for the product to be ready of investing capabilities by year 2 beta.
column7: Easy way to develop the modules and find out how to integrate Microsoft PowerPoint into the software. Finish the introductory level learning modules. Start to work on what the learning process looks like. (Gamification/quizzes for assessment)

column2: Secure at least $21,000 to hire 3rd party grad assistance. Secure an additional $4,000 for free spending for departments within the project. $25,000 total.
column3: Improve current interface to be ready for beta testing.
column4: Standardize and define what the process will look like. More documentation and the foundation for the new Department is complete. New branch in GitHub repository complete as well.
column5: Be meeting the highest level of accessibility for beta release. Every semester make sure the product is meeting the highest level it can.
column6: Actively meet all of the requirements of the general NASDAQ guidelines. (Does not need to be functioning completely)
column7: Have completed the introductory level modules. And starting on intermediate. Work on the learning process.

column2: Continuously work to find other forms of funding for the class. Scale relative to class needs. Keep the minimum funding at $25,000
column3: Try to implement non functional and functional parts that were not previously implemented.
column4: Defining 2 features that the R&D department wants in the product. 1 per semester, and implement.
column5: Do research into what the guidelines do not meet. Identify 4 current problems that the guidelines do not meet. 2 per semester. What can we do per semester to correct those problems that the guidelines do not address?
column6: Making sure that the financial capabilities are working and we are fully meeting all requirements.
column7: Have intermediate modules completed and work on Expert. Continued work on the learning process.

column2: Have secured 2 strategic partnerships for the program. Continue to scale funding for departments as needed. Minimum $25,000.
column3: More beta testing, and regular maintenance check
column4: Define 2 major challenges that the app/ product has and how to fix it. 1 per semester. And how to fix it with new/industry technology, each semester.
column5: Design what the interface would look like for different devices.(App, desktop, tablet,) And then implement.
column6: All hands on deck to meet competitive capabilities. 50 percent of industry capabilities.
column7: All learning modules completed. The learning process completed as well.

column2: Secure the total funding needed to make sure the project is able to release Alpha 1.0. The minimum funding raised at this point should be $100,000.
column3: The product is fully functional for app store capabilities. Alpha 1.0
column4: Adapt market research, what do competitors have that we don’t. Identify 2 things within the market that our product does not have that we want.
column5: Testing current product to make sure that it is accessible while in production.
column6: Tiered release scheduled for increasing financial capabilities. Subscription? Works with R&D to define the new features that the “Free” version does not have.
column7: Work out the process of accreditation with the system. Look into what is needed for continuing education application.
